textos_fuente.text: Chokoloskee RV Park | Waterfront Campground near the Everglades Skip to content Cove Communities Home All Destinations MH Communities RV Parks & Resorts Home & Cottage Sales Specials Resort Lifestyle Ways to Stay Cottages for Sale Specials Guest Portal Book Now Menu Close Resort Lifestyle Ways to Stay Cottages for Sale Specials Guest Portal Directions 239-695-2414 See All Destinations Directions 239-695-2414 Search for articles, topics, … Book Your Stay Cottages For Sale Chokoloskee RV Park View Available Homes Schedule a Tour Chokoloskee RV Park An RV Park Fishing Paradise on the Edge of the Everglades Discover truly incredible fishing when you vacation in Chokoloskee, Florida. Formerly known as Chokoloskee Island Resort, Chokoloskee RV Park welcomes anyone looking for a waterfront paradise and fantastic resort amenities. Recent upgrades to campground amenities include new docks, an improved marina, and new travel trailers for rent. This Florida RV resort also features 40+ RV sites and cottages for rent. There’s even an option to buy your park model cottage. Chokoloskee RV Park is located at the southernmost point of Florida’s SW Gulf Coast. The island paradise is over the bridge from Everglades City sitting between Ten Thousand Islands, and neighbors to the Everglades National Park. Find your escape and live the ultimate angler’s dream. Featured Amenities All Age RV Park Marina Boat Launch Ramp Waterfront ALL AMENITIES Key Info Site Map Brochure 239-695-2414 Directions Contact ALL AMENITIES Contact Why Choose Chokoloskee RV Park? Florida Waterfront Vacations Featuring Resort Amenities Recreation is a big part of life in this part of Florida and we have the resort amenities and fun activities to help you make the most of your vacation. From our Choko Cove famous parties and planned activities to hanging out at Liar’s Bench Pavilion, Chokoloskee RV Park has something for guests of all ages. RVers will marvel at the new RV sites featuring pavers, crushed shell, and landscaping. The new resort Tiki gathering spot is sure to be the center of social activities. Chokoloskee RV offers an on-site convenience store and the marina’s launch ramp is once again operational. The docks are still under repair and when completed, slots will be available for long and short-term rental. Don’t forget to ask about the boat and kayak rentals! There is nothing better than a good day on the water, surrounded by good people, fish tales, and a great location to top it all off. Book your stay today and see why many visitors call it a fisherman’s paradise. Check Availability Resort Experience Ways to Stay within the Waterfront RV Park RV Sites More than a place to park, it’s a place to belong. Choose from 40+ RV sites with water and power. Check availability Check availability Trailer Rentals Experience the best of Chokoloskee RV Park without hauling your RV. Check availability Check availability Cottage Rentals Give yourself more space by renting a cottage for your next fishing vacation. Check availability Check availability Cottages for Sale Make a Chokoloskee RV Park your vacation home when you buy a cottage. Check availability Check availability Staying Busy at Chokoloskee RV Park It’s all about enjoying what makes Chokoloskee Island so special – the outdoor lifestyle. The RV park staff are experts on fishing in the Everglades. Launch your boat or book a fishing charter for a world-class fishing experience. Call ahead and check with the RV park team for boat tour recommendations. There’s plenty to do if you prefer to stay on dry land too. Guests enjoy soaking up the sun by day and gathering around the fire in the evenings. Design your perfect vacation minutes from Everglades National Park at Chokoloskee RV Park, but first, check for specials or Good Sam discounts. See Activities Featured Guests & Updates Monthly Newsletter September Newsletter Tap to see the monthly newsletter, upcoming events, the manager’s fishing guide with details on where people are scoring the best catches. Learn more Things to Do Nearby Chokoloskee Island Old Florida at the end of the road. This tiny community is full of mystery and intrigue, and the waters are brimming with a variety of fish and game. Explore Chokoloskee Everglades Everglades National Park is an international treasure. Everglades City and Gateway to the 10,000 Islands are the main entrances to the park. Explore the Everglades 10,000 Islands Paddle to discover the mystical 10,000 Islands. Paddling routes are endless among the island-speckled seascape. POOL INFORMATION Updated 2025 Pool Hours and Rules About Chapel Creek Coyle Enterprises purchased 160 acres of land at Hefner and County Line Road in 2001 from the Bailey family, which had held it in their family since it was homesteaded in the Land Run of 1889. Chapel Creek was developed as a quiet and economical place to live and raise a family. Located in the Piedmont School District, it is close to shopping areas and the Kilpatrick Turnpike. A community pool and park was added by the developer in 2014 enhancing the addition. © Chapel Creek HOA  Website Design by Directing Design, Inc. COMMITMENT TO ACCESSIBILITY We are continuously working to improve the accessibility of our Website and ensure that it complies with recognized standards, including the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, Level AA. Our goal is to make the browsing experience as inclusive as possible for all users. Key Features of Our Website’s Accessibility: We aim to incorporate the following accessibility features: Language Tagging : The website includes language tags to ensure compatibility with assistive technologies like screen readers and Braille translators, facilitating a more inclusive user experience. Image Text Alternatives : Efforts have been made to provide descriptive alternative text for images, aiding users with visual impairments in understanding visual content. Color Contrast : Cove has implemented sufficient color contrast between elements and the background (with a minimum of 4.5 to 1) for any text, headlines, or other elements where color plays an important part in navigating and understanding the website. Design : The website’s design incorporates several key accessibility considerations to ensure an inclusive user experience. Interactive elements do not rely on color alone to convey information, and clear, consistent navigation guides users through the site. Form elements are paired with clearly associated labels for ease of use, while touch targets are sufficiently large (at least 48x48px) with adequate spacing between elements to ensure accessibility on touch devices. The site is fully responsive, adapting to various viewport sizes for optimal usability across different devices. These design choices collectively contribute to a more accessible and user-friendly website for all visitors. Ongoing Improvement: We are committed to making continuous improvements to the accessibility of our website. We regularly review our site to ensure compliance with current accessibility standards, and we are working towards meeting the requirements of WCAG 2.1. Feedback and Assistance: If you encounter any accessibility barriers while using our website, or if you have suggestions on how we can improve our accessibility efforts, please contact us at: Email: info@covecommunities.com Phone: (855) 574-4636 Postal Address: 2999 N 44th St, Suite 200 Phoenix AZ, 85006 We value your feedback and will work promptly to address any issues.       A HOT-HUMID climate is defined as a region that receives more than 20 inches (50 cm) of annual precipitation, and where the monthly average outdoor temperature remains above 67°F (19.5°C) throughout the year. Knowing your area’s climate zone (as assigned by the U.S. Department of Energy’s Building America Program into one of eight zones), can help you predict your heating and cooling needs. Humidity and temperature can of course vary, even by county. The Building America HOT-HUMID climate zone corresponds to the portions of IECC zones 2 and 3 in the dry category. About Us - Plum Creek Chapel Preview & Edit Skip to Content Area About Sermons Live Stream Donate Menu Menu Contact Main Menu (mobile) About What We Believe Our Staff Service Times & Directions NBW Ministries Weekly Devotional Missions The Steeple Story Sermons Live Stream Donate Contact About Sermons Live Stream Donate Menu Menu Contact Section Menu Section Name: About What We Believe Our Staff Service Times & Directions NBW Ministries Weekly Devotional Missions The Steeple Story About Us Our History Plum Creek Chapel was founded on September 15, 2002 and began in the old Roundup Ranch lodge eleven  miles west of Sedalia up Jarre Canyon. In June of 2003, we moved to the Sedalia Elementary School for three years, then leased the Renaissance Church on Highway 105 for four years. By God’s grace, we purchased our present building in August of 2010, and we continue to rejoice in the God who provides! Our Vision The vision of Plum Creek Chapel is to see lives changed for the glory of God in Colorado, the United States, and throughout the world. We accomplish this vision by: Reflecting grace in everything we do Proclaiming the Gospel clearly, accurately, and urgently Standing firm on the authority and sufficiency of Scripture Teaching the whole counsel of God Strengthening families to raise their children in the Lord Supporting one another through loving fellowship and benevolence OUR BELIEFS OUR Affiliation Plum Creek Chapel is affiliated with the Berean Fellowship of Churches .
